metadata.title: CVE-2017-14039 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A heap-based buffer overflow was discovered in the opj_t2_encode_packetfunction in lib/openjp2/t2.c in OpenJPEG 2.2.0. The vulnerability causes anout-of-bounds write, which may lead to remote denial of service or possiblyunspecified other impact.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
